Articles.Content:
Hello! Been loving the game so far. I just have a rather simple question: how can I go about measuring temperature above a certain point? I cant seem to get over 10k metres with a plane, is using a rocket and orbiting around that point till I get exactly above it the only option?

Thanks!
It's an option yeah, or fit a rocket to your jet and power your way up from below ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

I actually just thought about that! But I'm not quite sure how to go about it. Do you mean creating a rocket launching from the jet, or giving the jet more rocket-like power?

Thanks for answer by the way ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

I'd give the plane some rocket power, with a central liquid fuel and oxidiser tank and a LV-T30 or 45, and a pair of side tanks with liquid fuel only and basic jets, with the wings on those side tanks ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Also don't forget the thermometers!
Or progress more and get turbojet engine. The altitude numbers from contracts aren't really changing from 0.90, while aero changed a lot...
Thank you very much guys, will try the ideas out:cool:
